quotes.quote: Realism is often mistakenly identified with the view that there is some special discipline which has privileged access to the real.
Realism is knowing fantasy and reality intersect constantly. Realism is living with the awareness that every act changes the world.
Pure realism is both unsustainable and purposeless.
Realism can break a writer's heart.
Realism arises from the maturity of the minds, while Idealism arises from their conformity.
Realism is simply Romanticism that has lost its reasonthat is its reason for existing.
Realism is the light that shines between change and challenge.
It has been said that modern realism begins from the position that truth can be discovered by the individual through the senses.
Reality is a crutch for people who can't cope with drugs.
People want to see realism in action now.
There's a level of realism you can only achieve through the imaginary.
Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.
Realism is more important than the sentiment of the picture.
True realism, materialist realism lies in the search for the expression of forms faithful to their content. But there is no content detached from human interest.
Realism is condemned by those artists whose poverty of technique does not permit them to express it.
True realism consists in revealing the surprising things which habit keeps covered and prevents us from seeing.
Realism has always been called cynicism.
Realism is something we practice when we aren't feeling very well. When we don't feel up to the extra effort.
We can evade reality, but we cannot evade the consequences of evading reality.
We need realism to deal with reality.
A lack of realism in the vision today costs credibility tomorrow.
Realism and abstractionism are not enemies. They eat out of the same dish, but their digestive systems are different.
Idealism is like a castle in the air if it is not based on a solid foundation of social and political realism.
The only realism in art is of the imagination.
Realism is in the work when idealism is in the soul, and it is only through idealism that we resume contact with reality.
There is an instinct for realism, a powerful drive to reproduce oneself.
A realist is a man who knows both the world and his own dreams.
Realism is a corruption of reality.
Realism seems not like an end in itself, but like a portal to something truly new.
There is no realism without an element of idealism.
